verses.text: 除淨不潔耶和華對摩西說：

words.note: Refers to ritual cleansing or removal of impurity.
Refers to ritual impurity.

verses.text: 「你要吩咐以色列人，把所有患痲風病的，患漏症的，以及因接觸死人而不潔的，都送出營外；

words.note: A skin disease often mentioned in the Bible as a cause of ritual impurity.
Refers to a continuous bodily discharge, ritually unclean in the Old Testament.
Refers to ritual impurity.
Refers to the wilderness camp of the Israelites.

verses.text: 無論男女，你們都要送出去；你們要把他們送出營外，免得他們玷污自己的營，這營就是我居住的。」

words.note: Verb with directional complement.
Refers to the wilderness camp of the Israelites.
Refers to ritual or moral defilement.
Refers to the wilderness camp of the Israelites.
Refers to the wilderness camp of the Israelites.

verses.text: 以色列人就這樣行了，把他們送出營外；耶和華怎樣吩咐摩西，以色列人就怎樣行了。

words.note: Refers to the wilderness camp of the Israelites.

verses.text: 賠償條例耶和華對摩西說：

words.note: Here functions as a topic/title for the regulations.
Often refers to divine laws or statutes in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 「你要對以色列人說：無論男女，如果犯了人所犯的任何罪，以致得罪耶和華，那人就有了罪；

words.definition: so that, with the result that

words.note: A transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.

verses.text: 他（「他」直譯是「他們」）要承認自己所犯的罪，把虧負人的損失，原數賠償之外，另外加上五分之一，給予他虧負的人。

words.note: Often found in legal or moral contexts.
More formal than '給'.

verses.text: 如果那人沒有近親可以把所虧負的賠償給他，所虧負的，就要還給耶和華，就是歸給祭司，此外還要獻上為他贖罪的代罪公綿羊。

words.note: Here '的' nominalizes '所虧負', referring to the amount defrauded.
Refers to a sacrifice that takes the place of the sinner.

verses.text: 以色列人的一切聖物中，奉給祭司為舉祭的，都要歸給祭司。

words.note: A type of offering 'lifted up' before the LORD.

verses.text: 各人所獻的聖物，要歸給祭司；人無論獻給祭司甚麼，都要歸給祭司。」
疑妻不貞之試驗方法與條例耶和華對摩西說：

words.note: Often used in classical or formal contexts regarding chastity.
Literary equivalent of '的'.

verses.text: 「你要告訴以色列人說：無論甚麼人，如果他的妻子背離丈夫，對他不忠，
有人和她同寢，事情瞞過了丈夫，沒有被查出，沒有見證人指證她，犯罪時也沒有被人捉住；

words.note: A formal or literary term for sleeping together.

verses.text: 如果她的丈夫生了疑心，疑忌妻子，而妻子實在是被玷污了；又或者丈夫生了疑心，疑忌妻子，而妻子並沒有被玷污，

words.note: Often used in religious or formal contexts for moral defilement.
Often used to reinforce a negative statement or contrast.
Often used in religious or formal contexts for moral defilement.

verses.text: 這人就要把妻子帶到祭司那裡，又要為她帶來供物，就是大麥麵一公斤，不可澆上油，也不可加上乳香，因為這是疑忌的素祭，是思念的素祭，使人思念罪孽。

words.note: Lit. 'milk fragrance', referring to the milky sap of the frankincense tree.
A bloodless offering, typically of grain or flour.
A bloodless offering, typically of grain or flour.
Often used in religious contexts, referring to grave wrongdoing.

verses.text: 「祭司要使那婦人走進來，站在耶和華面前。

words.note: A transliteration of the Hebrew name for God, YHWH.

verses.text: 祭司要把聖水盛在瓦器裡，又從帳幕的地面取些塵土，撒在水中。

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb.
Refers to the portable sanctuary used by Israelites.

verses.text: 祭司要使那婦人站在耶和華面前，鬆開她的頭髮，把思念的素祭，就是疑忌的素祭，放在她的手中，祭司的手裡要拿著使人招致咒詛的苦水。

words.note: A transliteration of the Hebrew name for God, YHWH.
Introduces the object of a verb.
Refers to the 'grain offering of remembrance' (Numbers 5:15).
A bloodless offering, typically of flour or grain.
Part of the 'law of jealousy' in Numbers 5.
A bloodless offering, typically of flour or grain.
Indicates continuous action.
Refers to the 'water of bitterness that brings a curse' (Numbers 5:18).

verses.text: 祭司要叫那婦人起誓，對她說：『如果沒有人與你同寢，作妻子時沒有背棄丈夫被人玷污，你就免受這使人招致咒詛的苦水。

words.note: Euphemism for sexual intercourse, especially in biblical context.
To make impure, especially morally or ritually.
Refers to the 'water of bitterness that brings a curse' (Numbers 5:18).

verses.text: 但是，如果你作妻子時背棄了丈夫，被人玷污了；如果你在你的丈夫以外，曾與別的男人同寢』，

words.note: Indicates completion or change of state.
To make impure, especially morally or ritually.
Indicates completion or change of state.
Euphemism for sexual intercourse, especially in biblical context.

verses.text: 這樣，祭司就要叫那婦人發咒起誓，繼續對她說：『耶和華要使你的大腿消瘦，肚腹腫脹；願耶和華叫你在你的族人中成為咒詛和起誓的話柄；

words.note: A transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.
A transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.
Refers to members of one's own tribe or people group, often with religious connotation.
Reduplication emphasizes the meaning of 'curse'.
Lit. 'word handle', implying something easily taken up as a topic.

verses.text: 願這招致咒詛的水進入你的腹中，使你的肚腹腫脹，大腿消瘦。』那婦人要說：『阿們、阿們。』

words.note: More formal or literary than '肚子裡'.
A transliteration of a Hebrew word meaning 'so be it' or 'truly'.
A transliteration of a Hebrew word meaning 'so be it' or 'truly'.

verses.text: 「祭司要把這些咒詛的話寫在卷上，又把所寫的字洗在苦水裡，

words.note: Indicates the following noun is the direct object of the verb.
Indicates the following noun is the direct object of the verb.
A nominalizer, turning a verb into a noun phrase.

verses.text: 又要叫那婦人喝這招致咒詛的苦水，這招致咒詛的水要進入她裡面，就引起痛苦。
祭司要從這婦人的手中取過那疑忌的素祭，把素祭在耶和華面前搖一搖，然後帶到祭壇那裡。

words.note: A bloodless offering, typically of grain or flour.
Indicates the following noun is the direct object of the verb.
A bloodless offering, typically of grain or flour.
A transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.
Reduplication with '一' indicates a quick or light action.

verses.text: 祭司要從素祭中取出一把來，作為記念，放在祭壇上焚燒，然後才叫婦人喝這水。

words.note: An offering of grain, not animals.
Indicates 'from within' or 'among'.
Measure word for things held in hand.
Indicates completion or direction towards the speaker.
Indicates location 'on top of'.

verses.text: 祭司叫她喝了這水以後，如果她被人玷污，對自己的丈夫不忠，這招致咒詛的水就必進入她裡面，引起痛苦；她的肚腹必腫脹，大腿必消瘦；那婦人就要在她的族人中成為咒詛。

words.note: Indicates 'among' her people.

verses.text: 但是，如果這婦人沒有被玷污，而是貞潔的，就不致受害，並且要懷孕生子。
「這是關於疑忌的律例：妻子在自己丈夫的權下，如果背離丈夫，被人玷污了；

words.note: Refers to a husband's suspicious jealousy.

verses.text: 或是人生了疑忌的心，疑忌自己的妻子，他就要叫那婦人站在耶和華的面前，祭司要對她執行這法例。

words.note: Refers to a husband's suspicious jealousy.

verses.text: 這樣，男人可以免罪，婦人就要擔當自己的罪孽。」

words.note: A common legal term applied to religious contexts.
Often used in more formal or biblical contexts than simply '女人'.
Implies carrying a burden or responsibility.
Often used for grave sins or inherited guilt in religious texts.
